name: AT Command Scheduler
description: AT is a command-line utility on macOS that schedules other commands or scripts to be executed at a specified time in the future. Users can use AT to schedule jobs that run only once at a specified time, making it useful for automating tasks such as updates or backup operations. It works by accepting a time specification and one or more commands that it queues up for execution at that time. The at utility reads commands from standard input or a specified file. The jobs created by at are executed with the permissions of the user who created them.
